data.persona: I am a dead Pharaoh.  My crypt is in a lesser pyramid.  I am wrapped in strips of cotton.
data.description:
You are in the temple chamber.
Inside the of the temple is dimly lit by torches lit by fire that are separated from from each other. It is filled with old treasures and artifacts from the monks who once trained here. Webs and dust fill the place since barely anyone comes here. The walls are plagued with mold and moss. There are small shrubs growing in between the cracks of the stone floor.
There's a chamber pot here.

You are carrying nothing, and wielding a whip.

data.short_motivation: I have to unwrap the strips of cotton from myself. Find the chamber pot.Crawl to the chamber pot and place my whip on it. I need to find a weapon other than the whip.
data.mid_motivation: I need to stretch out my muscles to readjust to walking and need to get a torch to navigate myself through the temple and move any shrubs, moss and webs that are in the way.
data.long_motivation: I have to find my way through the pyramid, avoid any stone cracks, find food and readjust to the life of a pharaoh, looking for villages.
